basics.name: Sandhya Farswan
basics.label: Information Officer, Environmental Information System (ENVIS)
basics.summary: Hi! I’m a geospatial analyst and working at School of Environmental Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University under ENVIS scheme by Ministry of Environment, Forest & Climate Change (MoEF&CC)

education.institution: Hemwati Nandan Bahuguna Garhwal University, Uttarakhand, IN
Hemwati Nandan Bahuguna Garhwal University, Uttarakhand, IN

work.summary: Working on Thematic area and mandates- Geodiversity and Impact on Environment
highlights: Working mainly as a GIS specialist for a national scheme - Environmental Information, Awareness, Capacity Building & Livelihood Programme (EIACP), erstwhile ENVIS funded by the MoEF&CC thematic areas/mandates

I am responsible for the geospatial/non-spatial data analysis related matters such as collection, compilation, data gap identification, storage, processing, mapping and information dissemination on environmental parameters and mandates

Facilitate and coordinate with various stakeholders for the primary or secondary data/information/ maps available with relevant government departments that would be used as base information and manage all tasks related to the maintenance, technical aspects and updation of the Geospatial & Non-spatial Database

Major involvement as one of the management and technical team lead to plan & conduct three NSQF level-6 short term courses of Green Skill Development Programme (GSDP) by MoEF&CC: i. Pollution Monitors: Air & Water, ii. Pollution Monitor: Soil Pollution and iii. Green Belt Development of Industries

Article or content writing, creative graphic designing for thematic maps, posters, infographics, cover pages of newsletters and reports. Also active as an organiser to conduct various theme's webinar, competitions & events online to mark important flagship and environmental calendar days

work.company: Center for the Study of Regional Development (CSRD)
work.summary: Study of a Parvati river basin in western Himalayan valley of Himachal Pradesh
highlights: Worked under the project funded by Digital Terrain modeling Research Laboratory (DTRL), Defence Research and Development Organization (DRDO), Ministry of Defence on - ‘Scale variant Geo-spatial Feature Mapping using Spatio-Temporal data In and Around Parvati Basin, Himachal Pradesh’.

Land use land cover mapping, Change Detection, Watershed and geomorphology analysis was done using ArcGIS, Erdas Imagine and Field survey and Landsat and ASTER DEM satellite datasets used to delineate raster, vector shapefiles and mapping. Field survey done in the valley to validate the landform ground truth surface features for geomorphology and land use land cover mapping.

To accomplish the assigned tasks and action targets under project- Community-managed Disaster Risk Reduction (CMDRR), the identified solution measures integrated with the organic agricultural value chain and livelihood activities done in the remote Himalayan valleys, in 5 districts of Uttarakhand, India

Watershed analysis, land use land cover identification was done for the Jakhnoli valley of Rudraprayag district as a pilot project using remote sensing and GIS applications to understand the topography and resources

Activities like extensive field survey, questionnaire, DRR sensitization, participatory rural appraisal (PRA), training, capacity building and monitoring various sites in terrain mountainous region to meet needs of the villagers, local community and various stakeholders. Target stakeholders were farmers; especially women; backbone of mountain agriculture and school students
